comments.body: Please add more tests, e.g., mixed case `GROUP BY a, GROUPING SETS(ROLLUP(a, b), CUBE(a, b), ...);`

> Please add more tests, e.g., mixed case `GROUP BY a, GROUPING SETS(ROLLUP(a, b), CUBE(a, b), ...);`

Done

Could you add more test patterns? For example,
```
scala> sql("select a, b, sum(c) from t group by cube ((a, b), ())").show()
+---+---+------+
|  a|  b|sum(c)|
+---+---+------+
+---+---+------+

postgres=# select a, b, sum(c) from t group by cube ((a, b), ());
2020-11-27 15:43:52.365 JST [23118] ERROR:  syntax error at or near ")" at character 52
2020-11-27 15:43:52.365 JST [23118] STATEMENT:  select a, b, sum(c) from t group by cube ((a, b), ());
ERROR:  syntax error at or near ")"
LINE 1: select a, b, sum(c) from t group by cube ((a, b), ());
```

Yea, PostgresSQL not support empty set.
Will add more test after code refactor
Btw, any database-like system supporting an empty set in CUBE?

> Btw, any database-like system supporting an empty set in CUBE?

Have not see this point in their doc, and I have no env to test for this...

```
// PostgreSQL
postgres=# select a, b, sum(c) from t group by grouping sets((a, b), (a), ());
 a | b | sum 
---+---+-----
   |   |   3
 1 | 1 |   1
 2 | 2 |   2
 2 |   |   2
 1 |   |   1
(5 rows)

postgres=# select a, b, sum(c) from t group by cube((a, b), (a), ());
ERROR:  syntax error at or near ")"
LINE 1: select a, b, sum(c) from t group by cube((a, b), (a), ());

// Spark
scala> sql("select a, b, sum(c) from t group by grouping sets((a, b), (a), ());").show()
+----+----+------+
|   a|   b|sum(c)|
+----+----+------+
|   1|   1|     1|
|   2|   2|     2|
|null|null|     3|
|   1|null|     1|
|   2|null|     2|
+----+----+------+

scala> sql("select a, b, sum(c) from t group by cube((a, b), (a), ());").show()
+----+----+------+
|   a|   b|sum(c)|
+----+----+------+
|   1|   1|     1|
|   1|null|     1|
|null|null|     3|
|   2|   2|     2|
|null|null|     3|
|   1|null|     1|
|   1|   1|     1|
|   1|   1|     1|
|   2|   2|     2|
|   2|null|     2|
|   2|null|     2|
|   2|   2|     2|
|   2|   2|     2|
|   1|   1|     1|
+----+----+------+

May be we should add a check rule that cube/rollup groupingsets should not have empty set?
the result seems ok.
Could you check the behaviour of other systems (other than postgresql) when having an empty set in cube/rollup?

> Could you check the behaviour of other systems (other than postgresql) when having an empty set in cube/rollup?

Test in Oracle, it not support empty set in groupingset of cube/rollup too.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46485123/100535966-681a5880-3258-11eb-84da-849266ac02fe.png)

And which place should we prevent this illegal case?
 1. In AstBuilder throw a ParseException 
 2. In Analyzer  throw a AnalysisException
 3. in Cube/Rollup class with a assert ` assert(groupingSets.forall(_.nonEmpty))`

IMO we should throw ParseExceptionin AstBuilder
Okay, thanks for the check. So, could you follow the PostgreSQL/Oracle behaviour? Let's revisit it if other reviewers leave comments about the behaviour.

> Okay, thanks for the check. So, could you follow the PostgreSQL/Oracle behaviour? Let's revisit it if other reviewers leave comments about the behaviour.

Yea, updated
